body_html: If I've read the stack trace correctly, it looks like these allocations were made by the tensorflow::ConstantOp constructor, which allocates memory for a tensorflow::Tensor storing the value of each constant in the graph. That memory should be owned by a tensorflow::DirectSession object and freed when you delete the session. Can you confirm whether this happens?

body: If I've read the stack trace correctly, it looks like these allocations were made by the `tensorflow::ConstantOp` constructor, which allocates memory for a `tensorflow::Tensor` storing the value of each constant in the graph. That memory should be owned by a `tensorflow::DirectSession` object and freed when you delete the session. Can you confirm whether this happens?
